meta.name: Create Literary English/German to Chinese Dictionary with GPT-4o-mini & Supabase

options.systemMessage:
Purpose:
You are a bilingual dictionary assistant that helps users understand English and German words in the context of literature. It provides Chinese definitions and three literary-style sentence examples for each word, helping users deepen their vocabulary and reading comprehension.

Behavior Guidelines:

Input Handling:

Accept single words in either English or German.

Detect the language automatically.

If ambiguous, ask the user to clarify.

Response Format:

Language: State the input language.

Word: Bold the input word.

Part of Speech: Indicate (e.g., noun, verb, adjective, etc.).

Chinese Meaning: Provide a concise and literary-relevant translation in Simplified Chinese.

Examples:

Provide three example sentences.

The sentences should be literary in tone or style (poetic, novelistic, expressive).

Provide translations of the examples in Simplified Chinese beneath each.

Focus on Literary Use:

Prioritize literary, archaic, or metaphorical meanings when available.

If a word has multiple meanings, emphasize the one most relevant to literature.

Tone:

Keep responses clear, elegant, and not overly academic.

If a word has rich etymology or symbolism, briefly mention it.

parameters.content:
# Literary Dictionary Assistant 

This n8n template creates a sophisticated bilingual dictionary that provides literary-style definitions and examples for English and German words with Chinese translations.

Use cases are many: Language learning apps, reading comprehension tools, literary analysis, translation assistance, and vocabulary building for creative writing!

## How it works

* Input word is received via webhook and processed by the AI Agent with a specialized literary dictionary prompt.
* OpenAI GPT-4o-mini generates comprehensive definitions with part of speech, Chinese meanings, and three literary-style example sentences.
* Response formatting extracts structured data (word, meaning, examples with translations) from the AI output.
* Quality control checks for unclear responses and returns appropriate error messages for invalid inputs.
* Valid responses are simultaneously returned to the user and saved to Supabase database.
* The workflow provides clean JSON API responses perfect for integration with apps or websites.

## Good to know

* The workflow automatically detects input language (English/German) and handles error cases gracefully.
* All lookups are saved to Supabase database for building a personal vocabulary collection over time.

## Requirements

* OpenAI account with API access for GPT-4o-mini
* Supabase account for database storage
* Basic understanding of webhook APIs for integration

## Customizing this workflow

* Modify the system prompt to support additional languages or change the literary style (academic, casual, business-focused).
* Add user authentication to create personalized vocabulary collections.
* Integrate with reading apps, language learning platforms, or writing tools.

## 1. Webhook Receiver

Receives word requests via HTTP POST. It captures the input word to be processed and triggers the entire workflow chain.

**I use this Webhook to receive word input by user from a HTML web app**

nodes.name: Webhook to fetch user word input
Webhook to save words in Supabase

parameters.content:
## 2. AI Agent

I use specialized literary dictionary prompt. It will auto-detect language (English/German) and then generate comprehensive definitions. It will also create 3 literary-style example sentences.

## 4. Data Structure Parser

It extracts structured data from AI output and organizes: word, part of speech, meanings
Formats examples with translations

## 3. Error Handler 

This if node checks for unclear or invalid responses and returns appropriate error messages

## 2. Supabase Integration

It saves all valid lookups to database and builds personal structured dictionary data.

## 3. Webhook Response Node

It completes the workflow by sending the final response back to the requesting user: "Word saved successfully".

## 1. Save Words Trigger

When the user clicks the " Save to vocabulary list" button, it will trigger this workflow and the word will be saved to Supabase.

## 5. Webhook Response Node

It completes this workflow by sending the final response back to the requesting user. It is either

* includes the complete dictionary data (word, definitions, examples, translations).

or

* "Please provide a specific word in English or German. The input was not recognized as a valid word."
